sp.p: Softly and with emotion .But you usually call me “ little one , ” and to-day nothing but “ darling . ”

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Now , then , Pastor , we are ready for the toast ! Take up your glass , and fire away !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I am afraid it will be hardly as wicked and heathenish as you seem to expect .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Come , come , Pastor , do n't keep us waiting !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Well , what shall I say ? I am not going to preach you a sermon !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: No , no , Pastor ; we are content to wait for that till Sunday .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Well , then , you see , on a beautiful and dreamy night like this — may I say dreamy ?

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: You may , Pastor , you may !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: For we all dream at times , more or less , both young and old !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Ah , yes ! that is a failing we all have !! !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: On such a dreamy night , different emotions are aroused within us . We seem to be able to look into the future , and imagine ourselves able to fathom all mystery and heal all wounds . The common becomes elevated , our wishes become fate ; and now we ask ourselves : What is it that causes all this within us — all these desires and wishes ? It is love , brotherly love , that has been planted in our souls , that fills our lives ; and , it is life itself . Am I not right ? And now , with one bound , I will come to the point . In the revelation you will find : “ God is love . ” Yes , God is love ; and that is the most beautiful trait of our religion — that the best , the most beautiful within us , has been granted us by Him above . Then how could I , this very evening , so overcome with feeling for my fellow-man — how could I pass Him by ? Therefore , Mr. Brauer , no matter , whether pastor or layman , I must confess my inability to grant your wish , and decline to give you a genuine pagan toast ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Grasps his hand .That was well spoken , Pastor ! Pardon me , I was only jesting !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , no , dear uncle , not altogether . There I must defend you against yourself . A devout and pious man like yourself , t'was not entire wantonness , your desire to hear something other than religious , and since the Pastor has so eloquently withdrawn , I will give you a toast . For , you see , my dear Pastor , something of the old pagan , a spark of heathenism , is still glowing somewhere within us all . It has outlived century after century , from the time of the old Teutons . Once every year that spark is fanned into flame — it flames up high , and then it is called “ The Fires of St. John . ” Once every year we have “ free night . ” Then the witches ride upon their brooms — the same brooms with which their witchcraft was once driven out of them — with scornful laughter the wild hordes sweep across the tree-tops , up , up , high upon the Blocksberg ! Then it is , when in our hearts awake those wild desires which our fates could not fulfill — and , understand me well , dared not fulfill — then , no matter what may be the name of the law that governs the world on that day , in order that that one single wish may become a reality , by whose grace we prolong our miserable existence , thousand others must miserably perish . Part because they were never attainable ; but the others , yes , the others , because we allowed them to escape us like wild birds , which , though already in our hands , but too listless to profit by opportunity , we failed to grasp at the right moment . But no matter . Once every year we have “ free night . ” And yonder tongues of fire shooting up towards the heavens — do you know what they are ? They are the spirits of our dead and perished wishes ! That is the red plumage of our birds of paradise we might have petted and nursed through our entire lives , but have escaped us ! That is the old chaos , the heathenism within us ; and though we be happy in sunshine and according to law , to-night is St. John 's night . To its ancient pagan fires I empty this glass . To-night they shall burn and flame up high — high — and again high ! Will no one drink to my toast ?

div.stage: Pause .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Trembling .I will !

div.stage: They look into each other 's eyes and clink glasses .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Hesitatingly .I , too , George !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Stroking her hair sadly , patronizing .Yes , yes ; you , too .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Suddenly bursting out .You — you idiots ! What do you know about it , anyway ? I — I did n't understand it myself , but I have a presentiment there is something sinful about it all !

lg.l: My dear Mr. von Harten , above all your heathenism watches our good old
God , our Father , and therefore I fearlessly drink to your toast .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Well , well , I 'll not be the only exception .Drinks also . A glow much nearer , behind the trees . Louder yelling and laughter .Well , what is it now ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: They are dangerously near the sheds now .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Did n't I tell you to take the proper precautions ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: I did . They had only three tar-barrels early this evening . Where they got the fourth from , I do n't know .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: I 'll wager they found the barrel of axle-grease ! Why did n't you lock it up ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: You know yourself , on this day no lock or key is of any avail .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Do n't talk nonsense , but see what 's to be done . I will be there myself , presently . Be quick !Paul exits .I can n't depend on anybody these days ! Where is my hat ?Marie gets it .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Ca n't we go , too , papa ?

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Will you come , wife ?

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Yes , gladly , but stop scolding . There is n't a breath of air stirring , and therefore no danger .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Come along , Pastor !

div.stage: Exit Brauer , George , Gertrude and Mrs. Brauer .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Wo n't you accompany us , Miss Marie ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , thank you , Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Then may I remain with you for a while ?

sp.speaker: Several Voices
sp.p: Outside , calling .Pastor , Pastor !

lg.l: I will be with you in a moment !
Well , may I !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Why , certainly , if it gives you pleasure !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Pleasure is hardly the proper word . I wanted to thank you for insisting upon my writing the bridal-poem . It has been a work of pleasure , I assure you . Do you like it ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: It is very nice . Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Have you memorized it already ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I think so !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Then would you mind reciting it for me ? Come , I will assist you : “ The flowers , the beautiful blossoms ” —— Well ?—— “ are a maiden 's —— ”

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: You are acting so strangely to-day ! You are so shy — so ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: The St. John 's night oppresses me !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: That will soon be over .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Would that it were over now !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Perhaps the thought of traveling alone at night has something to do with it ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh !Recovering herself — lightly .You are right , Pastor ; but it can n't be helped !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Shall I come with you ? Oh , I 'll find something to be done in the city . I wo n't even have to ask permission . Anyway , I am longing for a glimpse of the good old town . I will inform the old pastor — I do n't think he has retired as yet ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Then please tell him —— I usually visit him myself every day , but now , just before the wedding , it 's impossible for me to call . Will you please tell him that ? I am so fond of him ! Tell him that , and in thought I kiss his hand .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Certainly . And may I accompany you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , thank you . Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Now let us speak openly , Miss Marie . I have been watching you all the evening . You appear to me — what shall I call it — like a mouse before a cat ! You need a protector ; some one in whom you can confide , some one ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And so you would like to be my father confessor ! Eh , Pastor ?

lg.l: You know very well we do not have that institution in the Protestant
Church , though at times it might prove a blessing ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Mischievously .And then again it might not ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: You are quite right . We should all rely more upon ourselves ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: With emphasis .I do that , Pastor , I do !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Yes , my dear Marie — pardon me , I should not have said that — and yet I must speak frankly with you ; you seem to have a fear — a dread ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Of the cat ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I wish I knew !! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: But supposing I were the cat , who would then be the mouse ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: That would be sinful and wicked in you !! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: But one cannot be the cat and the mouse at the same time ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Yes , one can ! But he who does , plays with his own destruction !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And if one destroys one 's self , who cares ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: You should not talk like that , Miss Marie .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , it is all nonsense , all nonsense , for to-night is St. John 's night . Do you see that fire yonder . Pastor ? They had to put it out ! But there , on the hill — look , there , there ! How beautiful ! How wild !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Yes , and when you look closely , it is nothing more than a mass of dirty lumber .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: For shame , Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Like everything that blazes , except the sun ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: You should not have said that , Pastor — you should not . I do n't want it ! I will not have you slander my St. John 's fires ! I want to enjoy it once — only once — then nevermore !! !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Disturbed .My dear Miss Marie , I do not understand the reason for your agitation , and I will not question you ! But of your struggles — you shall know that you have a friend near you , on whom you can rely , now and for all time to come . Marie , I do n't know how to express myself ; but I desire to shield and protect you all your life — I will worship you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Pastor , do you know who and what I am ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I do !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And who my mother is ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I know all !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Pastor , how am I to understand this ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Marie , I know I should not have spoken , at least not now . I should have waited — it was stupid of me , I know ; but I have such a fear — a fear for you . You are going to the city to-night and I do n't know what may happen ! But you shall know before you go , where you belong and that your future is assured !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: With a sigh of relief — almost a sob .Ah — ah — ah ——!

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Marie , I do not want an answer now . Besides , I must first notify my father . Though he is but a simple farmer , he shall not be slighted — Marie ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Shrinking — dully .Yes , that is — perhaps — what I need — ah !Sinks in chair .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Why , what is the matter ? Shall I get you a glass of water ? Or would you prefer wine ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: With an effort .Wine — wine — there — in the bowl !He helps her — she drinks .Thank you !Stirred .No one has ever waited on me before !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I will carry you upon my hands

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Very well , Pastor ; but no one must know before the wedding !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Perhaps on the wedding day — at the wedding feast ? Papa might make the announcement ; that would be such a fitting occasion !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , no ! I will have to much to do then .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Then , when the happy pair have gone ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: With sudden , impulsive decision .Yes , when they have gone !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Takes her hand .Thank you . Miss Marie .

div.stage: Voices are heard outside .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Sh —Withdrawing her hand .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Enters .Ah , here you are , Pastor ; we have been looking for you everywhere !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I am coming now , Miss Gertrude .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: It 's too late , Pastor , they are all returning !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Impossible ! Well , well , how the time passes , and one hardly knows how !

div.stage: Exit Pastor .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Embracing Gertrude .Will you forgive me , darling ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Timidly .I have nothing to forgive !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Do not say that ! I have done everything — everything — you must ——

div.stage: Enter all .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Well , my dear Pastor , time stands still for no one ; so you had better stop excusing yourself and empty your glass . ‘ Twill all come out right in the end .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I think I had better go now ; for here every one is making fun of me .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Pastor , I need hardly tell you , that you are always welcome in this house .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I am sure of it , Mr. Brauer ! If I did not think so , I would not take that matter so lightly ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Jokingly threatens him with finger .Pastor ——

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: With a happy glance at Marie .Good-night .Shakes hands with all .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Good-night !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Good-night , Miss Marie !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Shaking his hand .Good-night , Pastor !

div.stage: George , with a questioning glance , advances a step or two .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: George , see the Pastor to the gate !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: As though awakening .Yes , uncle .

div.stage: Both exit .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Well , Henry , everything has quieted down !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: It 's about time , too ! Why , its eleven o'clock ! Come , let 's to bed .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Good-night , papa !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Affectionately .Good-night , my pet !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Good-night !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: By the bye — when will you be back ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: To-morrow , about ten , papa !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Now be careful ; no unnecessary exertions — understand ? The day of the wedding will be hard enough on all of us .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , papa dear !Kisses him .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Enters at this moment .We have still an hour and a quarter till train time . I will wait for you here , Marie .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: You might help each other pass away the time .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: I want to sit up , too .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Tut , tut , ray pet ; you go to bed , you need the rest .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Whiningly .Well then , good-night .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: In silent fear .I can n't stay here —— Mama , I want to ask you about something ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Then you will come down in time for the train ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , in time for the train .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Good-night , George .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Good-night , auntie !

div.stage: Exit Mrs. Brauer , Gertrude and Marie .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: You know where my cigars are ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Yes !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: And if you need anything to keep you awake — I have left the key ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: In monosyllables .Thank you !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Well , what in ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What 's the matter —— Oh , my dear uncle , if I have failed to pay you the necessary respect , I beg your pardon .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Respect ? Oh , damn you and your respect !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Uncle ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: See here , perhaps I did wrong ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You — wrong ? How ?

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Have you forgotten what passed between us yesterday ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: My dear uncle , that seems to me so far , far away !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: It strikes me you are going at a pretty fast gait !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: At any rate , uncle , do not worry about it . It will all come out right in the end .As he is listening towards the door , gives a sudden start .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: What 's the matter ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: I thought I heard some one ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Some one of the family perhaps , upstairs . Very well , then all is well , my boy ! Good-night , my son .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Good-night , uncle !Brauer exits , shaking his head .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Sits at table — tries to read — listens , goes to door C .— calls out softly into the garden .Who is there ?Still softer .Is that you , Marie ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Whining outside .It 's only me !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Surprised .Gertrude , what do you want ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Gertrude enters in nightgown and flowing hair .I am so uneasy , George dear ; I just wanted to look at you once more before going to sleep .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But , little one , if papa should see you like this —— Quick , go back to your room .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: I cannot , my heart is so heavy .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: How so , dear ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: George , I have been thinking ; I really am not good enough to be your wife .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Wha — what nonsense ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: I am too silly — oh , yes ; I never know what to say to you ! I am so stupid .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why , my child — darling — pet ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: A while ago , out in the garden , and the moon shining so brightly , you walked by my side in deep silence ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why , mama was with us ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: George , it is yet time . If you love some one else ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: In heaven 's name , child , have you ever mentioned this to any one ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Only to papa ; he was very angry and scolded me dreadfully .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: H 'm ! Now listen to me , my pet ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Rather than make you unhappy , I would jump into the river ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: In the first place , your presence here in this condition is decidedly improper ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: But we are to be married in three days ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: So much more reason .Stroking her hair .What beautiful hair you have , dear !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Happily .Do you like it ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And in the second place , I will have none other than you . We will love each other very much . At first you will be my playmate — and then — later , perhaps — my real mate . Are you satisfied ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes , dear !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And now , you must go to bed !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Then I will wrap myself in my hair — and I will dream of you and what you said — that it is beautiful — and so I will fall asleep . Good-night , George dear !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Kisses her on the forehead .Good-night !

div.stage: He gloomily takes position at table with a sigh when Gertrude exits , covering his face with his hands . Marie enters softly .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , you have come ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: It is early yet , is it not ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: We have a full hour more . Have they all gone to bed ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I think so . All the lights are out .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Come , sit here ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I — I — I think I will go back upstairs !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , no ; here is something to read ! You see , I 'm reading myself .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Very well .Sits .But , George , I would really prefer to go to the depot alone .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Softly .Marie !She shuts her eyes .Are you tired ?She shakes her head .One whole hour I will have you all to myself !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: George ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie !! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: The fires have all gone out , I suppose ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Ah , yes ; a small pyre of wood — it is soon burned down !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And then it 's as dark as ever !!! But , George , how beautifully you spoke this evening ! I have never heard anything like it before .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You were the only one who understood me .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No wonder ! It was as though I spoke the words myself — that is , I do n't mean to say ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What , dear ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , you know !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But I do n't know !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: After a pause .George , I have something to confess to you . In fact , that is why I came down here so soon . You shall know it , you alone . I have this day given my hand ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: With a start .Marie !!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Astonished .Well ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: To whom ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Why , to the pastor ! Who else could it be ? There is no one else !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Reproachfully .Why did you do that ? Why did you ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I have my whole life before me , and the firespointing to fields and to heartwill not burn forever ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Bitterly .You should not have done it — you — it is a ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Sh — not so loud !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But you do not love him at all !!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: How do you know ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Bitterly ,How ? Of course , how should I ? I do n't know ! Pardon me ! Well , I congratulate you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Quietly .Thank you !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But why am I the first one to be taken into your confidence ? Why not uncle ? We two have not been so intimate as ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , we two have not been very intimate — I only thought ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: So , then , we have both our burden ; and we soon will have to part . Therefore we can now safely speak of the past . My manuscript you read ! You even went so far as to perjure yourself on account of it . Oh , you do n't mind a little thing like that ! I wish I were the same ! You know the subject of my verses , and we must now understand each other fully . Now , tell me openly , why , why did you treat me so unkindly , to say nothing worse , in former days ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Did I , George ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: ‘ Tis hardly necessary to remind you of all the indignities you heaped upon me . It almost seemed to me as if you purposely intended to drive me mad . Do you remember the day when I followed you into the cellar , and you turned and ran out and locked the door , and compelled me to remain there all night ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Smiling .Yes , I remember !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why did you do that ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: That is very simple . You are Count von Harten — and I ?— I am but a poor Lithuanian foundling — aye , worse than that . If you follow such a one into the cellar , she knows , or at least thinks she knows , your purpose .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: So , that was the reason ! And at the same time you went under your manzanillo-tree to die ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And did you never realize the real state of things ? Gertrude was then still a child — and because I could not win you , I took her . Did that thought never occur to you ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: How could I ever dare to think that ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But later ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: The day before yesterday , when I read your book , I felt it for the first time .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And now , it is too late ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , now it is too late ! Had I felt then as I do now , I would not have resisted you ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , do you know what you are saying ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Breaking out .Oh I do n't care , I do n't care ! It is my fate . You must rule and govern — and I — I must serve ; and in the end — we both must die ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , you should be loved , you must be loved — beyond all senses — loved beyond all measure !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Pointing towards R .He loves me !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: He ?— Bah !! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Do n't be angry , George dear ; you do n't dare love me yourself . You can never be anything to me !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , never ; for this house must be kept clean . No , no , this house must not be soiled . We would both suffocate in our shame . But we can think of what might have been ; that is not sin , is it ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What were your words ? “ They are the wild birds of paradise , that have escaped us . ” That was it , was it not ? How beautiful !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: I do n't remember !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: But I am not a wild bird , George ; I am tame — so tame ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You are tame ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: For you , George dear , only for you !! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , my love !Strokes her hair affectionally , then moves away .No , no , we must be strong ! Only a few minutes ago , Gertrude came softly down those stairs ; if she should come again — my God ——!

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What did she want ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You can imagine ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: The poor thing ! But you will love her ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: As well as possible ! But then I must not think of you .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: But you must not think of me — and I will try and not think of you !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Never , Marie ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Only occasionally — on holidays ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Only then ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And on St. John 's eve ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: When the fires are burning ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , and when the fires are out , then I shall cry ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie !!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , no , George , sit still — I will sit here . Some one might be in the garden , after all .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: They are all sound asleep !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Even so ! We must be brave ; not for mine — but for your sake , George .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why did you say that ? What do you think of me ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I think you are hard-hearted .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And yet you love me ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , I love you , for your own sake . For you have had to struggle and fight — and that is what made you what you are . I have also fought and struggled ; but I have lost faith in myself — lost faith in everything . If you only knew !! Sometimes I am afraid of myself — sometimes I would commit murder , so restless and without peace I am .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: With me you would have found peace . We would have worked together and planned through half the nights — and you know how ambitious I am .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And so am I , for you ! You should be the first and greatest . They all shall bow before you — I myself will kneel before you and say to you : “ You love to rule and command ? Now rule — now command !!!!!! ”

div.stage: Throws herself before him — her arms around his knees , looking up .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , in heaven 's name rise ! If any one should see you so ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Let them see me ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie ! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Rising .You are right . It was low in me . But he who originates where I do , is low — so low ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Do n't think of it , Marie ! Think of this house and all the love it has given you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: How quiet everything is — not a sound to be heard — as silent as the grave ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Then be content , for they have buried us together !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If they only had ——!

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And see the pale moon — how it throws its silvery rays over the garden — and yonder is your manzanillo-tree .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , yes , do you see it ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And its white , trembling leaves ; see , see , each one seems alive — though not a breath of air is stirring . Come , let us go to it .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Cowering .No , no , I think it is time — we must ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Sh !— Sh !——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What is it ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: There — something moved . It must be Gertrude .Goes to door C. and calls .“ Gertrude !!! ”

div.stage: Short pause .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: You must have been mistaken !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , no ; I saw a shadow . “ Gertrude ! ” Remain here , I 'll go see !Exit into garden .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , I 'm so afraid , George — so afraid ——!

div.stage: Pause .
George returns , pale and agitated , trying to control himself .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Who was it ? Who was it ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Oh , no one — no one ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , there was — I can see it in your face !! Was it Gertrude ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Then it was papa ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , no .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: George , you are as pale as death ; What has happened ? Tell me !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Nothing , nothing ! There was a stranger in the garden — I sent him away .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What stranger ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Pained .Do not ask me !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Dully .Oh , I know — I know ! It was — my mother ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Well , since you have said it ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What did she want ? But why do I ask ?Covers her face with her hands .Oh , my God — my God !!! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Suddenly .Close the blinds — I have a fear — tight — so !! Now put up the bars — so — and here , so — so ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Embracing her .Marie ! my darling !!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Hold me tight !! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Like this ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , like that !She moves close to him .Here I want to sit still ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Looks at watch .If we only have time to catch that train ——The whistle of a locomotive is heard in the distance . He starts .Did you hear that ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Smilingly .Yes !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What was it ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: It was the train !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Can you hear it this far ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: At night you can !

lg.stage: Sinks into chair L. of table , back to audience .
lg.l: My God ! what shall we do now ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Softly .I will tell you what we will do ! We will sit still here — quietly — till the next train — till four o'clock !!! !

div.stage: Throws herself upon George , passionately kissing him .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie ! My love , my all !Kisses her .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Kiss me again ! Now , then , do you understand me ? I am my own master , and care not for myself —— To-night is St. John 's night !!!!!! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And the fires are burning low ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , no ; let them burn ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Yes , yes ; let them burn — they shall burn !!!! !

div.stage: Marie disengages herself .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Kiss me no more — let me kiss you — I will take all upon myself — I will take all the consequences — my mother is a thief , and so am I ! George —

div.stage: Throws herself into his arms with complete abandon .
Lights out . Curtain .
END OF THE THIRD ACT .

div.head: ACT FOUR

sp.speaker: Same setting . Morning . Centre table is decorated with flowers
sp.p: Brauer , George and Gertrude are on veranda at rise of curtain . In open door , C ., Mrs. Brauer . All listening to quartet , singing , “ This is the day of our Lord ” by Kreutzer . As curtain rises , Katie enters , L ., listens also , and dries her eyes . At the end of the serenade , Brauer starts to make an address , and with George and Gertrude leaves the veranda .

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: Mrs. Brauer , I would like to speak to you a moment .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Wiping her eyes .What is it , Katie ?

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: Sniveling .Oh , I 'm so happy ——

div.stage: Church bells are heard softly in the distance .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: There go the church bells . Have you put plenty of wine and luncheon in the arbor ?

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: Yes , ma'am ! Miss Marie and I have prepared a lot !

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: What did you want to see me about ?

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: I wanted to ask you about the roast ; shall we put it in the oven now , and just warm it up for dinner ? Miss Marie thinks ——

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Never mind ! I 'll be down in the kitchen in a moment !

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: And another thing , Mrs. Brauer ; wo n't you please try and get Miss Marie to take a little rest ? She has been hard at work since two o'clock this morning , and all day yesterday she was in the city . She can n't stand it .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Oh , on a day like this , we must all put our shoulders to the wheel .

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: Ah , Mrs. Brauer , you and I are old , and not much good for anything but work ; but we must spare our young people . Why , at times she almost gives out .

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Well , I will come and see for myself .

sp.speaker: Katie
sp.p: Thank you !!! Oh , such a day !!! I am so happy ——Exit both L .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Enters with George and Gertrude .Thank goodness , that 's over . Let me see : first it was the old soldiers , then the Turners , and now the Singing Society —— But do you know , I am so sick of all this wine — give me a brandy .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Gets drink from sideboard .Yes , papa !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: To George .And what 's the matter with you ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: With a sigh .Nothing !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Imitating him .Nothing !!! I can n't quite make you out —— Here , have a drink ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No , thank you !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Well , then , do n't ! Your health , my pet !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Drink hearty , papa !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Rises .The carriage will arrive here sharply at ten ! Understand ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Yes !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: And your friend from the city — we will find him at the station ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Yes ; he arrives quarter to ten .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: For we must have two witnesses .— Do you know what I would like ?Tapping him on breast .I would like to be able to look in there .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Oh , let him alone , papa ! He is now my George . If I am satisfied with him ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: You are right ! He who gets my child can laugh — but he also shall laugh . Understand ?Exit R .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Never mind him , George dear . You need not laugh if you do n't want to . Not on my account .Bells .Do you hear , George ? The church bells , ringing softly , singing , like human voices !!!! That is for you and me ! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why for us ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: It is the old pastor 's desire ; half an hour this morning , and then again this afternoon , when we exchange rings . Do you know , George , mama says a bride 's dream the night before her wedding is surely an omen . Do you believe that ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Preoccupied .Yes .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: I dreamed last night of a large , yellow wheat-field , in which a poor little rabbit had hidden itself ; and high above , in the air , I saw a large hawk . Then it appeared to me that I was the little rabbit , and in fear and dread I called out “ George ! George ! ” when suddenly it shot down upon me !— just think ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And then ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Then I awoke . The cold perspiration stood thickly upon my brow —— Oh , George dear , you will protect me ? You wo n't let any one hurt me , will you ? For I am only a poor little rabbit , after all ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Staring before him .My God !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: George , I wanted to ask you something .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Well ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: You do n't love some one else , do you ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Disturbed .But , my child ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Well , you know that if a bride cannot laugh on her wedding day , she loves another ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why , nonsense ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Unshaken .Oh , yes , George ; I read it myself . And even if you do , George , I feel so — my love for you is so great , it could move mountains . I love you so dearly —— She will surely learn to forget you , I will love you so much .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: But , my pet ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: No , no , George . You see , I do n't blame you so much . How could I ? For what am I , compared to other women ?— George , does she love you so very much ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Who ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Oh , you know . But do n't worry , George dear ; she will forget you in time ! Do n't you remember Robert , our neighbor 's son ? He threatened to kill himself if I did n't marry him , and he has already forgotten me ! And to-day , when we stand at the altar , at the Doxology and the exchange of rings , I will nudge you softly , and then we will both pray to our good Father in heaven to make it easy for her ; for no one shall be unhappy on this day ! Why , George , you are crying !!! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Crying — I ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Why , yes ! Here are two large tears running down your cheek .Wipes his eyes with her handkerchief .So there ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Tell me , my pet ; and if we should be parted , after all ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: How could that be possible ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: If I should die — or ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Embracing him .No , no ! Do n't say that ! Do n't say that !! !

div.stage: Marie appears in door , seeing embrace .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Startled .Some one is here ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: It is only Marie .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Pointedly .You seem to be particularly affectionate to-day .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Miffed .We always love each other . Oh , perhaps that does n't please you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: It is nothing to me !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Half Jesting .Besides , what do you want here ? Is n't there anything to do in the kitchen ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Stung , but controlling herself .Mama has sent me ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes , yes , dear ; you are just in time to dress my hair . Have you hairpins ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Shaking her head .I will get some .Reels .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Affectionately .What 's the matter , dear ? Oh , you must be tired !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I am not tired .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes , yes , you are . Now you sit down here . I will fetch them myself .Quick exit .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Full of fear .Gertrude !! !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: I must speak with you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Speak ; I am listening .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Why this tone ? Does it perhaps mean that between us all is over ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If it is or is not , it matters little .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Am I , then , to understand ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: My God ! Have you not Gertrude ? But now I saw her in your arms ! What do you want with me ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: I must speak with you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Not now ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Re-enters .Here are the hairpins .Marie takes them .I have also brought my dressing-sacque and combs . Now we will excuse you for a little while , George dear . You can give your judgment later .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: With a glance at Marie .May I not remain ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: No , no . You would criticise and find fault , and embarrass Marie , and me , too . Now be good , George , and go into the garden .George exits .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Holding sacque .Will you put this on ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: No , I will put it around me .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: As you please . How do you want your hair dressed , high or low ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: But Marie , we had decided upon that ! Have you forgotten ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , pardon me — I — of course we had !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Then give me a kiss !

div.stage: Marie suddenly takes her head in both hands and stares at her .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Frightened .Why do you look at me so strangely ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Embraces her fiercelyMy darling !!! !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Oh , you hurt me !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Perhaps you hurt me , too ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: I ? How so ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Has begun to comb .How can you ask ? You are about to be married — and — and — I — I am jealous of you !

lg.l: Just wait , Marie , dear .
“ In a year , in a year , when the nightingale comes —— ”

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Intensely .When the nightingale comes ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: You will be Pastor 's wife .Laughs .

div.stage: Marie , with one braid in her hand , bending back , laughing loudly and forced .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: In pain .Oh , you are pulling my hair ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Any one as happy as you should be able to bear a little pain . There ! I will braid it into your hair — for you are happy , are you not ? Very happy ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes ! I am — that is — I would like to be — but George — he is so sad .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: George ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Lurkingly .Perhaps you were right ! Perhaps he does love another !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Softly groaning .Oh , why did you say that ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Because —— No , no — how could he ? That was wicked in me , was n't it ? How could he think of another , when he looks at you ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: No , no , Marie , you are right ! I told him so myself !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Slowly and marked .And what did he say ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: He ?— He said nothing ! And then — he cried ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Triumphantly .He cried ? George cried ? Have you ever seen him do that before ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: No , never !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: To herself .He cried ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: And then he said : “ What if we should be parted , after all ? ”

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If who should be parted — you and he ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes — if he should die ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If he — oh , that is what he meant ! Oh , well , he just wanted to say something .With forced lightness .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Of course he did . But what about the other woman ? Oh , I did n't let him see that I cared — and for the time I did n't care , really ; but now , when I think of it ! My God !— if it were really so ! If I only knew !!!!!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Of course , he would not tell you !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Do you think he would tell any one else ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , sooner than tell you .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Yes ! I suppose so !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Shall I ask him ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Oh , if you would do that for me ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: There now , it is done . Here is the comb and the rest of the hairpins . Now go !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: And do you really think he would tell you ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I am sure he will .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Oh , Marie , how grateful I shall be to you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Pushes her out of the door .Go now , go !Stretches herself .Ah — ah — ah ——Calls softly .George !There is a knock at the door .Come in !

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Enters .Pardon me , Miss Marie ; is Mr. Brauer in ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , Mr. Paul !

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: The assistant pastor would like to speak to him — but here he is , himself .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Enters .Good-morning , Miss Marie !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Offers her hand hesitatingly .Good-morning !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: I will wait here , Mr. Paul !

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Then , Miss Marie , will you please give me the key to the cellar ? I want to put the beer on the ice .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Gets key from keyboard .Here it is .

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Thank you !

div.stage: Exit .
Pause .

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: And have you nothing to say to me ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: What shall I say , Pastor ?

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Are you not happy this day ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Hard .No !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Not even on account of our betrothal ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: We will have no betrothal , Pastor !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: What are you saying ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I shall leave this place ——

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: You ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: To-day , I leave this house !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Pardon me , if I have forced my attentions upon you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No ! You have not !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: My attentions were honorable , I assure you ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Thank you , Pastor , I know that ; but ——

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Then it is not on my account you are leaving ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Certainly not !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Does any one here know of your intention ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No one !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Miss Marie , I am still a young man ; if I should mention such a word as “ life 's happiness , ” it would , perhaps , sound absurd . Therefore , I will not speak of myself . My fate is in my own hands . But if you realize this moment what you owe to this house — and I say this not for mine , nor for their sake , I say it for yours and yours alone ; though I am but a poor mortal — it pains me — but be that as it may — Marie , if you cause a discord in this house , the blame will rest upon yourself .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Perhaps !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Pardon me — I will not question you . I wish to know nothing ; that , in the end , is always the best . Did I not love you as well as myself , I would not speak another word ; but as matters stand now , I will say one — aye , one more word — I would not have dared to say otherwise . The greatest , the highest thing one possesses in this world , is his life 's melody — a certain strain that ever vibrates , that his soul forever sings — waking or dreaming , loudly or softly , internally or externally . Others may say : “ His temperament or his character is so , or so . ” He only smiles , for he knows his melody and he knows it alone . You see , Miss Marie , my life 's happiness you have destroyed , but my life 's melody you can not take from me . That is pure and will always remain so . And now I say to you , Miss Marie , if you fill this house , where you have obtained everything you possess — honor , bread , and love — if you fill this house with sorrow — if you dare to sin against your father and your mother ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: One moment , Pastor . My father and my mother — what do you know about them ? My father I do n't know myself , but my mother ? Ah yes , I know her well ; and from her I have inherited my life 's melody . This melody has a beautiful text . Do you want to know what it is , Pastor ? It is , “ Thou shalt steal . Steal everything for thyself — thy life 's happiness — thy love — all — all . Only others will enjoy it in the end . ” Yes , Pastor , my mother is a thief . On St. John 's eve she came stealthily over yonder garden hedge ; and as my mother , so am I ! And now , Pastor , ask me no more ; I need all my senses , for to-day my entire happiness is at stake ! There — now you know all !

sp.speaker: Pastor
sp.p: Yes , now I know ! Farewell , Miss Marie . I will forget this day , perhaps ; you — never ——

div.stage: Exit .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Enters door L .Was that George , who just now left ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Were you at that door , listening ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Marie !— For shame !!!! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Now go and dress yourself ; I will call George . Go now , go !

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: And will you come and tell me at once ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: At once ! Yes ! !Gertrude exits .Marie calling softly .George ! George !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Enters from veranda .Are you alone ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Have you arranged it so ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: You wished to speak to me , so I have arranged it !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , I wished to tell you . One hour more I am a free man — and my mind is made up . It is yet time to change our fates . What will you answer me ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Answer you ? Why , I do n't know what you want .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You know it well enough . I want you ! Do you hear me ? You , who belong to me for life — I want you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Softly — happily .I thought the fires were out — and you had forgotten me — and now you want me ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Softly .Are you not mine ? Are you not my wife in the eyes of heaven ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , but in the eyes of the world it is Gertrude !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Must it , then , be so ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Doubtingly .Go — go — you love her ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Yes , I do love her . How could I help that ? Do you not also love her ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Bitterly .Ah , I do n't know . A few moments ago , when I saw her in your arms — and you wept , too — only , because you love her !! Oh , but I can bear it !! I will bear it like — like — ah !—— But there — that is no one 's affair but mine ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: So , so , that is no one 's affair but yours , eh ? You might have invented a sweeter torture . I meant to remain an honorable man all my life ; if unable — well , there are plenty of bullets left .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: And do you wish to die ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: I do not want to , I must !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: George , then take me with you ?He shakes his head .For years I have carried the wish in my heart — to kill you ! Then I would kiss and love you like mad — and then follow you into eternity ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Nonsense , girl , nonsense ! Ca n't you see , how one turns round and round and round in a circle , till at last to find no other escape than death ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: I am not afraid to die ; though with you , I 'd rather live ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: To live , dear , will require more courage for both of us .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: How so ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Can you ask ? Here in this house , to which we owe everything — both you and I ? Where they gave us food , shelter and love ? After all that , would you have the courage to destroy their happiness ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: The good old pastor used to say : “ You must have the courage to do everything , except to do wrong . ” I would even have the courage to do wrong .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Shall I put you to the test ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If you will give me your hand now and say to me : “ Come , we will run away , through yonder garden gate — just as we are — now , this very moment ” — you shall see how I will run !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What ?— Secretly — without telling any one ? Is that what you mean ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Do n't you ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Laughs bitterly .No , no !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Well , what then ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Face to face , like a man . There he stands — I here . If he will give me back my word , ‘ tis well . If he refusesdetermined, ‘ tis also well .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: My God ! You know his temper ! He will kill us — he will kill us both !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: ‘ Tis death either way ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: George — think ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Oh , I have thought of it for two days and two nights . One is madness and the other insanity . There is no other way .Pained .Only the thought of the child gives me pain ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Of course , if your feelings for Gertrude ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Then it is your desire ?She nods assent .Very well ! So be it ! But remember , it is a question of life and death !— And , therefore , you yourself must be present .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: In terror .I ?— I be present when you ask him ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What ?— You , who wish to become my helpmate and partner in life , and share all my life 's troubles — you would desert me now — desert me in this hour ?— and I very much fear , not the worst in store for us ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: No , no , George ; it 's not that — not that ! But you know how we have feared him and have trembled for years — and now I should ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: If you can n't even do that ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: If necessary — yes I — I will do it .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Then — as soon as he returns .Brauer is heard breathing heavily .Ah , here he is !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Enters .Why , that is almost an old-time Biblical miracle . Just think , children , think of it —— But where is Gertrude ? Well ? Ca n't you speak ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Trembling .I think she is dressing !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Well , it will interest you also , so listen : I met the assistant pastor as he came from the house here , and he told me , rather piqued , that our good old pastor had suddenly risen from his bed and limpingly insisted upon delivering the wedding discourse himself . Well — what 's the matter ? Are n't you glad ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: H 'm ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Of course , you are a perfect heathen ! But I say , our assistant pastor must have been terribly put out . He had been preparing for that same address for days . He looked rather crestfallen ; but then , there is no help for it .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Pardon me , uncle ; in order to save time , I must ask you for an interview .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: What , again ? Ca n't you wait till afternoon ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: No ! Before the ceremony , if you please .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Startled .Wha — oh , I see . I suppose now you will demand more than I am willing to give ? Marie , leave usPaul enters .Well , what now ?

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: There , look at him ! Well , have you lost your tongue , man ? Why do n't you speak ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: No , no , Mr. Brauer , I have something to say to you — alone .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Then why do n't you come nearer ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Whispering .We have just now caught the old woman .

lg.l: What ? Marie , you may remain and chat with
George for awhile ; he is a very interesting young man .
Where ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Down in the cellar ; just as I wanted to put the beer on the ice , I found her there in a dark corner , loaded down with plunder !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Is she there now ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Yes , struggling like a demon .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Undoubtedly this offense will earn her a good long term in prison and we will be rid of her for a long time ! But how to get her out of the house ?

sp.speaker: Paul
sp.p: Leave that to me Mr. Brauer ; I know a way to keep her quiet .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Yes , yes , and in the meantime I will make out the papers and we will hand her over to the Gendarme ; that will be the best . Children , I will be busy for a moment ! Wait here until I return .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Do n't forget , uncle !

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: No , no . I 'll be back in a moment . Come , Mr. Paul !

div.stage: Both exit .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You are trembling ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Am I ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie dear , I am with you . No one shall harm you !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , it is not that .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What , then ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Oh , I do n't know . It has suddenly come over me so ——Starts .Sh ! He 's coming !

div.stage: Noise . Scuffling of feet and smothered cries are heard .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What is it ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: In God 's name , be still !

sp.speaker: Gypsy
sp.p: Calling for help .Mine daughter ! Mine Mamie ! My Mamie ! !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Hear ? Hear ? My mother ! They are taking her away — to prison ! Sh ! Be still ! No , no ; do n't open the door ! Be quiet ! Be quiet !

sp.speaker: Gypsy
sp.p: Not as loud as before .Oh , mine daughter ! My Mamie — my Mamie ——!Dying out .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Will you not go out to her , no matter what she has done ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: How can I ? How can I ? I am afraid — afraid ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Then shall I go ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Frightened .No , no ; do n't leave me !! Sh ! Be quiet ! So , quiet ! Now they have gone ! Thank heaven !Again wailing , but very distant .Hear ? Hear ? Let her shriek ! Let her call ! I cannot help her ! I am a thief , the same as she . I , too , have come to this house , and I have stolen . But oh , my God , what have I stolen ? What have I stolen ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Come , Marie , control yourself ! Think of what we have before us !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , yes — I 'll be quiet ! What have we before us ? No , no ; I will not — I cannot — I ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Do you mean to ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: In door .Did you hear anything , children ? Any noise ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: We heard screams and a scuffle . What was the matter ?

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Oh , nothing of any consequence . Do n't mind it . An old vagabond of a woman , that 's all . I have only to sign the papers now , then I 'll be back .Exit .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Hush , not a word , not a word ! She out there must go her way , and I must go mine !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: What do you mean ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: You said it yourself . ‘ Tis madness ! Yes , yes ; ‘ tis madness ! All — all ! What we do — what we desire — all — all !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Or do you imagine for one moment we could be happy together ? No , I know you too well . I know the certain result . You would never forgive yourself nor me , and in the end life would become a burden to me , if only because I was in your way . Yes , yes , that would be the end of it all ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie , I will be faithful to you forever , let come what may , be it good or bad ; you know that !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Yes , thank God !— yes !

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: If there was only the slightest possibility of a chance to escape from all this whirl — then we might be free , we might —— But no matter what we begin , we cannot shake off nor disregard our obligations to this house ; never , as long as we live !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Therefore , what more can you desire ? Everything on earth we possess , all that was beautiful , all the love , all — all , we gave to each other . There is nothing more to give , for either one of us . St. John 's night is past , the fires are out , are dead ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And what shall become of us ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Of you ? That I can n't tell . Perhaps you will be happy , perhaps not ; that must all rest with yourself . And I ? Oh , be content . I will take care of myself . As soon as possible I shall leave this house . Not to-day , as I would like — it might create suspicion ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And where will you go ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Ah , the world is large . I shall go far , far away , where no one will ever find me . No , no , not even you , George .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: And if you should go to ruin out there ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Do not fear . I am the calamity child , the foundling . My hands are hard and callous — see , see ! Just like my heart is , now . I will work and work , and toil , until I fall exhausted — then I will sleep and rest , until it is time for work again ; and thus I will perhaps maintain a miserable existence .

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: You say you are a calamity child ! Well , so am I . But our accounts do not harmonize . You are going out into the world and misery , and it was I who drove you to it . Even did I not love you as I do , that thought would follow me forever and embitter my entire life . But , be it so . We are both children of misery ! Therefore let us grit our teeth , shake each other by the hand — and say farewell !

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Softly .Good-bye , Georgie dear — and — do n't be afraid — he is not yet coming — and forgive me — do you hear ? From to-day — you understand ? Did I not love you as much as I do , this would not have been quite so hard ; but there — there — ‘ tis all right now — I know ; I can never be entirely poor now ; for once , at least , the fires of St. John have burned for me — once — just once ——

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: Marie ——

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: Glancing around .Do n't — do n't ——

sp.speaker: Mrs. Brauer
sp.p: Enters , followed by Gertrude .Has n't the carriage arrived yet , children ? And where is papa ? It is time to go .

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: He is coming now , I believe .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Enters .So there , I am ready to go ! But , that is , you wanted to speak to me first ?

sp.speaker: George
sp.p: With a glance at Marie .It is all settled now , thank you .

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Then come , wife , my coat , quick !

div.stage: She helps him with frocks after he has divested himself of jacket .

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Aside to Marie .Did you ask him ?

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: And what did he say ?

sp.speaker: Marie
sp.p: It was all nonsense , my pet . He loves you and only you . He never has loved any one else — he says — and he will be very happy — so he says ——

sp.speaker: Gertrude
sp.p: Embraces him joyfully .My darling George ——

sp.speaker: Brauer
sp.p: Come , come , my child — time enough for that after the ceremony . Come !

div.stage: All follow him to the door . When George reaches door he turns , and as he takes one parting glance at Marie , Brauer pushes him off . Marie stands motionless , looking after them , handkerchief in mouth , nervously forcing it between her teeth .
Curtain .
END OF PLAY .
